alert.note: Alert for Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 02 at 6:55AM CDT until August 02 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Monona County in west central Iowa... Northwestern Burt County in east central Nebraska... Northeastern Cuming County in northeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Wayne County in northeastern Nebraska... Thurston County in northeastern Nebraska... * Until 745 AM CDT. * At 654 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Wakefield to near Bancroft, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pender, Emerson, Walthill, Winnebago, Bancroft, Rosalie, Thurston, Macy, The Highway 9 And 51 Junction, Omaha Reservation, and Winnebago Reservation. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 122 and 125. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
